oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Stable feet before a night out: Bovine arthrodesis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Breuer, Ryan M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine
lameness
arthrodesis
hoof
joint
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lameness in cattle is one of the top causes of lost production in the United States. It affects milk production, feed and water intake, reproduction, daily gain, and animal wellbeing. While there is increasing information available in the literature de足scribing lameness in dairy cattle, comparatively very little is published on lameness in beef cattle. One of the most potential足ly debilitating causes of lameness is a septic distal interphalan足geal joint. When this occurs, an arthrodesis is a useful proce足dure to maintain the welfare and production of the bovine.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2023 Recent Graduate Conference Proceedings; 71-73
